item.title: Fortnite Ballistic: Best Weapons, Ranked
item.description:
In Fortnite Ballistic, players can purchase equipment between rounds, choosing from a diverse weapon arsenal to match their preferred playstyle and range requirements. Teams can strategically combine the chosen weapons to address different roles and ensure optimal coverage for every player.

Understanding which weapons perform best is crucial, as selecting the right ones can give you a significant edge in matches. This advantage could lead to effortless wins when paired with precise aim and smart strategies. Here's our ranking of the best weapons in Fortnite Ballistic.

10 Thunder Burst SMG

Burst Fire Falls Short

Damage

Magazine Size

Fire Rate

Reload Time

Credit Price

27

27

8.32

2.25s

1,100

The Thunder Burst SMG performs decently overall, but in a tactical shooter like Fortnite Ballistic, where precision is critical, its burst-fire mode can be a drawback. Missing shots during an engagement can put you at a serious disadvantage. Even though enemies often remain stationary while shooting, any slight movement can leave you vulnerable when using this weapon.

While this SMG might have some utility in close-range situations, these scenarios are generally best avoided. Additionally, there are far better alternatives available for covering short distances effectively.

9 Hand Cannon

Great Damage But Limited Utility

Damage

Magazine Size

Fire Rate

Reload Time

Credit Price

50

7

2

2.2s

800

The Hand Cannon stands out for its excellent damage, especially when paired with perfect accuracy. However, this weapon shines primarily during pistol rounds, such as at the start of a match or when switching sides. With its slow rate of fire and limited magazine size, the Hand Cannon is most effective for saving Credits for later rounds, thanks to its affordability.

To maximize its potential, precision is crucial – missing shots can leave the player exposed, especially against enemies equipped with Shields and superior gear. While it can be effective when used strategically from cover, its limitations make it challenging to compete with higher-tier weapons as the match progresses.

8 Hammer Pump Shotgun

Perfect Accuracy Required

Damage

Magazine Size

Fire Rate

Reload Time

Credit Price

94

6

0.88

5.25s

900

Although the Hammer Pump Shotgun boasts impressive damage output, its effectiveness is significantly limited by its reliance on close-range engagements. Using the shotgun demands precise aim in Fortnite since each shot gives gamers only one opportunity to hit their target. Missing will leave them highly vulnerable during the weapon’s lengthy reload process, which is one of the slowest among all available options.

7 Reaper Sniper Rifle

One Shot, One Kill

Damage

Magazine Size

Fire Rate

Reload Time

Credit Price

150

3

0.66

3.5s

5,000

In a mode like Ballistic, where eliminating enemies from a distance while staying out of harm’s way provides a significant advantage, the Reaper Sniper Rifle stands out as one of the top choices – particularly for players confident in their precision.

With a 150-damage output, this Sniper can take down an enemy in a single shot, even if they are fully shielded. However, its main drawback is its high cost, which may require sacrificing other essential and versatile equipment, including alternative weapon options that could better suit different scenarios.

6 Frenzy Auto Shotgun

Keep Firing Without Hesitation

Damage

Magazine Size

Fire Rate

Reload Time

Credit Price

68

8

2.75

3.7s

1,600

Close-range combat can be challenging, especially with weapons that have a low hit probability, but the Frenzy Auto Shotgun stands out as a reliable exception. If you’re a player who thrives in close quarters and knows how to maneuver effectively, this weapon could be a game-changer for you.

Its automatic firing mode allows for continuous shooting when engaging enemies up close, and with its relatively high damage output, landing three well-placed shots is often enough to eliminate your opponent swiftly.

5 Ranger Pistol

Loyal and Reliable Companion

Damage

Magazine Size

Fire Rate

Reload Time

Credit Price

26

12

5.75

1.5s

Free

The Ranger Pistol stands out as a unique weapon, deserving its own category, as it’s the only one that remains available at all times, regardless of the player's primary weapon choice. This pistol becomes a loyal companion during side switches and throughout matches.

Its ranking lies in its consistent availability at no cost, combined with respectable stats. While it requires a bit of precision to land shots effectively, its competitive damage output makes it a solid fallback option. Since it’s a weapon gamers will frequently rely on, regular use and the best settings will help them master its handling, allowing them to maximize its potential during crucial rounds.

4 Striker AR

Reliable Long-Range Weapon

Damage

Magazine Size

Fire Rate

Reload Time

Credit Price

39

30

11

3.2s

2,500

Close behind the top contenders is the Striker AR , a weapon known for its consistent performance, high fire rate, and great ammunition capacity. While it’s a solid choice, other options in the game tend to outshine it, particularly at longer ranges.

In a mode where precision and quick reactions are essential, the Striker AR’s slower reload speed places it as the third-best option among Assault Rifles. However, those slower playstyle players who feel more comfortable with it, either due to the optic or other stats, can rest assured that this AR is still a reliable weapon to pick.

3 Hyper SMG

Fast-Firing Powerhouse for Close Range

Damage

Magazine Size

Fire Rate

Reload Time

Credit Price

26

30

13.33

2s

1,500

The Hyper SMG is an excellent choice for close-range combat in Fortnite Ballistic, offering moderate damage and the ability to fire rapidly, allowing you to eliminate enemies quickly.

With its large magazine, ridiculously fast rate of fire, and a 2-second reload time, this weapon is perfect for aggressive playstyles. Priced at only 1,500 Credits, it pairs well with other gear to help you dominate short-range engagements. If you prefer a confrontational approach – while still adhering to the tactical shooter mindset – this SMG will let them take out enemies before they have a chance to react.

2 Nemesis AR

Versatile Assault Rifle

Damage

Magazine Size

Fire Rate

Reload Time

Credit Price

40

25

9.75

2.5s

2,500

The Nemesis AR is a highly versatile weapon in Ballistic, offering high damage, a large magazine size, and a competitive fire rate. It excels in both long-range and close-quarters combat, making it ideal for a variety of situations.

With its easy-to-control automatic firing mode, the Nemesis AR makes it easier to eliminate enemies, even in fast-paced scenarios. Compared to other options, it’s more forgiving, making it an excellent choice for players seeking a reliable rifle that can perform well in both planned engagements and unexpected close-range confrontations.

1 Enforcer AR

High-Damage Long-Range Powerhouse

Damage

Magazine Size

Fire Rate

Reload Time

Credit Price

65

12

5.25

2.2s

2,000

At the top of the rankings for its remarkable damage is the Enforcer AR . Despite being semi-automatic, this weapon excels when you have strong accuracy and can land well-placed shots consistently.

It deals 65 damage per shot, meaning you can eliminate enemies with just three bullets, even if they have full shield protection. While its magazine size is small, the low bullet requirement per kill allows you to take down several enemies before needing to reload. Additionally, its affordable price compared to other options makes it a popular and viable choice.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Could Do Wonders With a PvE Mode
item.description:
With the launch of Marvel Rivals , Marvel fans are getting to step into the shoes of their favorite heroes in a brand-new iteration of the Marvel universe. However, unlike the likes of Marvel's Spider-Man , this version of the characters has them doing battle against each other in classic 6v6 hero shooter matches. That makes for a whole new type of Marvel game that fans seem to be flocking to. And while that approach is working well so far, Marvel Rivals may want to consider taking on PvE as well.

As of now, NetEase Games seemingly has no plans to bring PvE to Marvel Rivals . The studio's primary focus seems to be on delivering a strong PvP experience that players will want to keep coming back to for years. But, if it wants to take the concept to new heights, then it really should consider throwing a PvE mode into the mix. Not only could Marvel Rivals ' gameplay work extremely well in a mode such as that, but the Marvel universe has 85 years of storytelling just waiting to be explored in the video game space.

Marvel Rivals Feels Tailor-Made for a PvE Mode or Event

The Marvel Universe is Filled to the Brim With Stories to Be Told

The Marvel universe is built around the concept of heroes taking on villains across Earth, the galaxy, time, and even the multiverse. It has made for some fantastic adventures over the years, the likes of which the Marvel Cinematic Universe has done a great job of showcasing. Fans have fallen in love with the battles of the Avengers, the trials and tribulations of the X-Men, and the roguish exploits of the Guardians of the Galaxy. With each passing year, those adventures have only grown.

Through Marvel Rivals , players get to step into the shoes of many of those heroes, with some making their first major video game debut, like Jeff the Land Shark. However, unlike those stories, this iteration of the universe is vastly different from what has come before. While that has made for an exciting and satisfying gameplay loop, there is something special about seeing these heroes actually be heroes. The best way to display that type of story would likely be through a PvE mode.

Marvel Rivals Has the Perfect Opportunity to Craft a Fantastic PvE Mode

As of now, Marvel Rivals is building out a seasonal story that involves the vile Doctor Doom. It remains to be seen just where that story goes, but there is a strong chance it will culminate in some massive final confrontation. Because the game is strictly PvP, that confrontation may only be seen in the game's comic strips, as dialogue between the characters, or in special maps. But, with a PvE mode, NetEase Games could have players actually witness and fight through that finale, making for something truly special.

Along with that, NetEase could also introduce a plethora of special PvE events themed after various events across Marvel's history. It would hardly be the first hero shooter to do such a thing, and with the vast library of characters and stories to pull from, the potential is seemingly limitless. Maybe they need to combat hordes of Ultron drones, maybe the Chitauri are invading some of the maps, or maybe Sentinels have set their sights on the players. Whatever story the studio wanted to tell, Marvel Rivals ' gameplay could lead to a fantastic experience.

Not only could it give Marvel Rivals some fun side content and also help serve the story, but it could also help set the game apart from games such as Overwatch 2 considerably. That game has garnered much criticism for not delivering the PvE story that was initially promised. If Marvel Rivals was able to offer one in its place, then it may even be able to cement itself as the new genre kingpin, as long as said PvE story is actually well done.

item.title: Minecraft Player Builds Incredible Desert Temple in the Game
item.description:
Summary

  • A Minecraft fan built an epic desert temple with vibrant colors that stands out in the community.
  • The player spent 10 hours creating the temple using diverse block combinations, showcasing creativity.
  • Minecraft offers limitless creative opportunities in a sandbox world for players to explore and build.

A creative Minecraft fan online has shared their epic desert temple build, which they have brought to life in their in-game world. This unique Minecraft build uses tons of different colors, yet still remains true to the desert aesthetic.

Over the years, Minecraft fans have become accustomed to sharing their incredible creations with other players online. There are so many out there at this point, that it can prove very difficult to stand out from the crowd - only the best of the best gain traction in online communities like Reddit. Not all builds have to be enormous in scale in order to be impressive, though. Just recently, another Minecraft player built an incredible replica of SpongeBob 's Krusty Krab, showing how sometimes, the influence of other franchises can often bleed into these kinds of fan creations.

Redditor MooshroomShark shared their incredible Minecraft build, a massive temple built in the desert. The temple is extremely grand, with screenshots showing what it looks like in both day and nighttime. The illuminated nighttime version really shows how impressive this creation is. According to MooshroomShark, they spent about 10 hours on the build, not including breaks. Their full process involved building a skeleton version of the temple out of wool first, which really helped to cut down the process of getting the details right.

Minecraft Desert Temple Build

Perhaps the most impressive thing about MooshroomShark's Minecraft temple build is their use of color, which several players in the thread pointed out. It manages to use several bright and bold colors, without ever looking too busy. MooshroomShark claims that they were "trying to use mangrove, sandstone, and red sandstone but then realized that there was space for some terracotta and prismarine patches," while learning that "red sandstone looks really good with resin, mangrove red looks nice with sandstone, and green blocks in general look nice in a desert." It's always interesting to see a player take some of Minecraft 's best building blocks and use them to such great effect with this kind of consideration.

Minecraft fans have been spoiled by Mojang of late. Earlier this month, Minecraft released the Garden Awakens update, which brought the Pale Garden biome into the game, as well as a new hostile mob: the Creaking. This has been released under Mojang's new approach to Minecraft updates, with a focus on more regular content drops rather than just one or two per year. This approach gives players more fresh content to enjoy throughout the year, which is why it is proving popular with players at the moment.

item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth Devs Talk Accolades, PC Release, and Part 3
item.description:
The year has been good for RPG fans, and one of the crown jewels of 2024’s RPG scene is absolutely Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth . The game has received numerous awards and nominations at game awards shows across the industry, including a nomination for Game of the Year at The Game Awards 2024. That's not the only thing it showed up with. Square Enix announced Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth 's PC release date, January 23, to bring its expanded view of the classic PlayStation series to a wider audience.

As the team shifts gears toward the third and final installment of the FF7 Remake project, Game Rant spoke with producer Yoshinori Kitase and director Naoki Hamaguchi at The Game Awards to look back on Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth ’s success. Alongside its accolades and PC release, we also discussed some of the changes in the title, including Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth's ending. We also spoke about their proudest accomplishments in the title and their hopes for the future. The following transcript has been edited for clarity and brevity.

Please note that this interview contains spoilers for Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth

Reflecting on Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth

Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth has been racking up accolades as a critical darling following its release, and it's easy to see why. The middle child of the FF7 Remake project is visually breathtaking, brings in beloved characters from the broader Compilation of Final Fantasy 7 , and continues the project’s commitment to deepening and enriching the narrative of one of the best RPGs of all time.

Q: What’s it like to be getting accolades for all the work you’ve done on Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth ?

Hamaguchi: With the offline version being released and receiving over 90 points on the Metacritic score, it felt like quite a feat that we haven't achieved in a while. In terms of when we first released Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth , we were very confident in the quality of the game.

It's been about eight months since the release, and we are entering this awards season. We've been seeing a lot of nominations and wins even, and it feels like we've been sort of appreciated or given this sort of acclaim for what we have done throughout this year. It makes us very proud, and it's a very happy feeling.

Q: Did you feel nervous about how fans would receive any particular part of the game? Or something fans were excited about that surprised you?

Hamaguchi: I think the most recognizable would be Cissnei from the Compilation of Final Fantasy 7 appearing in the game. Those who are familiar with the universe might be very excited to see her showing up. When the game was released and I saw the players' reactions, I was really glad to see that people were actually excited to see her.

Kitase: And one more thing about player reaction is the ending and Aerith’s fate. Of course, we've been kind of hinting at it, and we've been mentioning it throughout our messaging leading up to the release. Our intent behind that sort of depiction of those final scenes was to connect it because we have a third installment waiting for us in our trilogy, so the way we depicted that series of scenes differs from the original Final Fantasy 7 .

I think, for those who have played the original, we have gotten their interest going, speculating and whatnot. But at the same time, we have seen mixed reactions. Some people reacted differently to how it may be interpreted, so it's very interesting to see people having their own interpretation with Rebirth and having that sort of struggle to try to speculate what's going on. It's very interesting to see these different reactions, and realizing that people do have different ways that they look at it and think about what has happened.

Q: What was it like having to balance gamers with expectations from both the original Final Fantasy 7 and the way Remake established things might play out differently with people who, for instance, don’t know Aerith’s fate?

Kitase : We have this sort of understanding that some people already know what happens in the original story, so with that understanding, we had to approach the way we depicted this loss of Aerith in a different way in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth . With the original Final Fantasy 7 , Aerith was sort of suddenly taken away from us, and we kind of leaned into that sort of sudden feeling of loss. Whereas in this iteration, we tried to approach it with the mindset of “we can't really grasp that this is actually happening,” like the reality hasn't hit yet. I think that's how Cloud probably felt and probably how the players felt, so that was the kind of thinking that went into that sort of depiction of Aerith’s fate.

Q: Rebirth also massively expanded Zack’s role in the story of the original Final Fantasy 7 . What was it like incorporating such a beloved character from the wider Compilation of Final Fantasy 7 ?

Hamaguchi: First and foremost with the whole Remake project, our goal was to incorporate elements of the different titles that are spread out in the Compilation of Final Fantasy 7 in general. It's good.

Of course, with the Remake project being a trilogy, we are expecting a time span of perhaps around 10 years. We want to make sure that we are also continuing to engage with our players, making sure that we are incorporating elements that are familiar, and introducing elements that are something that the players would look forward to that's within the Final Fantasy 7 universe. We mentioned Cissnei earlier, and then Zack was another one. We looked for characters or settings that are familiar to those who know the series and are something that can reach them easily throughout our Remake titles.

With that in mind, our overall vision across Remake , Rebirth , and of course, the third installment is to continue bringing that sort of excitement and a sense of surprise, and while doing so, incorporating the different elements that are spread out through our Final Fantasy 7 brand.

Q: What are you both most proud of in Rebirth ?

Kitase: If I were to list what I’m proudest of, one area would be the Gold Saucer and the theme song that we had Loren [Allred] sing, No Promises to Keep . Aerith and the Gold Saucer location, I believe, is a scene the fans of the original would be really looking forward to seeing in the Remake project. The date event and that whole sequence, as well as the stage play, was not as elaborately done in the original, so we tried to make it more of a spectacle, especially with acting out on the stage and that kind of theater experience. Having our setting and our stage, having Aerith there, and then having that theme song play as the characters take the stage really matched her emotions. And I think we were very successful in bringing that to life.

Hamaguchi: For me, I would mention the world map and that sort of overworld that the characters can traverse through. I'm sure players were looking forward to seeing how we would reimagine that overworld of the original into a more modern sort of setup, and we worked really hard in terms of trying to get it to a very high quality and allowing players to explore the field with excitement. I think that could have only been achieved because our development team has been working on not just Rebirth , but they have on since Remake , so they have the skills and knowledge to develop something like that. With the third installment coming up within our trilogy, I think they can continue to strive and endeavor and take on more challenges, so that's why I feel that it's a very exciting area that I wanted to bring up.

What’s Next for the FF7 Remake Project

While the biggest thing on the horizon for the retelling of Final Fantasy 7 is the third and final installment of the project, there’s also the debut of the PC version of Rebirth , announced at The Game Awards. Hamaguchi and Kitase looked ahead at both and gave insights into what’s coming up as the project progresses.

Q: Looking ahead to the final chapter of the trilogy: do you know how it all ends?

Hamaguchi: For sure, we do have this sort of goal of where it all lands with the conclusion of the trilogy. In that sense, we do know how it will all end, and right now, we are trying to get that delivered to our players and trying to build all the details that go into that package.

Q: Is there a moment from Part 3 that you’re looking forward to bringing to players?

Hamaguchi: With Remake and then Rebirth , we're hoping that the players have seen the evolution of Final Fantasy 7 , with Remake being more story-driven and then Rebirth having that sort of open field where you can traverse freely. Then, we are interested in producing the Highwind, so in the third title, we're hoping that it will allow for an even more expansive map and players will be able to experience that.

Q: Do you see the PC version of Rebirth as being the definitive way to experience the game?

Hamaguchi: I just want to clarify one thing ahead of time in terms of the content of the game. Of course, rather than reallocating our development resources to extra content, as we did for Intermission , we do want to concentrate on working on the third installment. From that aspect, we do not have any sort of additional episodes on the PC version. Just wanted to get that out of the way.

In terms of the graphic fidelity and the quality that we're offering, the PC version is definitely improved compared to the PlayStation version. Specifically, the lighting processes have been reassessed overall, so we are confident that the way the characters are set in the different scenes, as well as the modeling of the textures, have been improved since the PlayStation version. We are hopeful that the PC version of Rebirth will be of a graphical quality you can only experience on a PC.

Q: How does it compare to the PlayStation 5 Pro version of the game?

Hamaguchi: If we’re looking at a high-end PC, I think it's higher quality in terms of graphical fidelity. Of course, with the higher end, we had these different offerings. We also have graphical settings where people can configure the options, but at the same time, we do want to reach as many PC players as possible. We're, of course, accommodating and optimizing for people who may not have as high-end of a PC, and we're also striving to be fully functional on the Steam Deck as well.

Q: If this was the last thing you could say to fans before disappearing to work on Part 3, what would you want to say to them?

Hamaguchi: In terms of Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth , we first released it on the PlayStation 5. When we first released it, many players and fans out there were clamoring for the PC version as soon as possible. We're very excited that we're finally able to have players experience Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth , not just on the PlayStation, so I'm very happy and excited to deliver this to our waiting fans.

Kitase: Touching on what Hamaguchi-san said, we do want to have as many people as possible play Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth . We're hoping that, with this PC version release, we can gain momentum, and we can continue that momentum until the conclusion of the trilogy. We're hoping to carry those feelings that the players would have throughout, through until the conclusion.

[END]

item.title: Mech Arena Promo Codes (December 2024)
item.description:
Mech Arena is a dynamic multiplayer shooter for mobile devices in which you can experience an unforgettable experience of controlling a mech. Having chosen a large robot and equipped it with parts and weapons, you can go to one of the game modes to test your skills and earn currency to buy something more powerful. Victories bring tons of valuable currency rewards and even cases, but if you want to get something for free, use Mech Arena promo codes.

Using codes, you can get in-game currency, components for your mechs, or other stuff. However, codes have a limited expiration date, so you should use them as soon as possible.

Updated December 15, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: The latest codes will help you make significant progress in the game. For your convenience, we have collected them in one place. Check back here regularly to get even more options.

All Mech Arena Codes

Working Mech Arena Codes

  • MIDGAMEGIFT - Enter this code to get the 200 A-coins and Credits.
  • MIDGAMER - Enter this code to get the Prodigy Crate.
  • SPOOKYSHOT - Enter this code to get the Epic Skins.

Expired Mech Arena Codes

  • mech3years - Enter this code to get the Golden Age Epic Skin.
  • FIREPOWER - Enter this code to get the rare weapon Rocket Mortar 10.
  • CHAMPION - Enter this code to get the Skin.

While you can get all the best parts and weapons for your mechs by just playing the game, sometimes there's nothing better than a little freebie. Of course, you will not get super powerful items using the codes, but you can get a decent weapon or some money to buy new items quite early on. After all, replenishing your hangar with new components is one of every player's main goals, allowing you to diversify the gameplay significantly. However, reward codes have a limited expiration date, so hurry up and get all of them.

How to Redeem Mech Arena Codes

Unlike in many mobile games, the ability to redeem codes in Mech Arena is available from the first seconds of the gameplay. To do this, you need to copy the active code and follow these steps:

  • Launch Mech Arena .
  • Once in the main menu, click on the envelope icon at the top of the screen to go to the Mail tab.
  • Go to the Promo Code tab.
  • Enter the code in the Enter Promo Code text box.
  • Click Confirm, and you will receive your rewards.

How to Get More Mech Arena Codes

As with most other free mobile games, you can find more Mech Arena promo codes during events and holidays or as a regular promotional reward created to increase popularity. You can find a list of all new codes by checking our guide periodically. However, if you want to keep abreast of all the in-game news, you can follow the official developer pages:

  • Discord
  • Twitter
  • Facebook
  • YouTube

Mech Arena is available on mobile devices.
